title: Trigonometric Function - Modeling Height of Tide

content.question: At a coastal city, the height of the tide, in feet (ft), is modeled by the function <math alttext="h"><semantics><mi>h</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses equals 6.3 cos open parentheses pi over 6 t close parentheses plus 7.5"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>6.3</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>7.5</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 12"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> hours. Based on the model, which of the following is true?

choices.label: ​The maximum height of the tide is <math alttext="13.8"><semantics><mn>13.8</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ft.

​The maximum height of the tide occurs at <math alttext="t equals 6"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> hours.

​The minimum height of the tide is <math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ft.

​The minimum height of the tide occurs at <math alttext="t equals 12"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> hours.

content.answer: ​The maximum height of the tide is <math alttext="13.8"><semantics><mn>13.8</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ft.

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
